channel.title: RSPS Script Engine - MUST READ - Last Updated: July 03 - BETA 3
channel.description:
SkillScape Scripting Engine is a Very useful Program, Has a Built-In Programming Language, Script Converter. You can make my new .ssscripts I created very easily, and quickly, then save them as .ssscript or click Export and have them Converted to a Java file. Using this makes code shorter, easier to understand, faster coding practices, No need for capitals.
How to support this: Donate Send code examples
Current Version: BETA 3
Current Features: - Text Editing Control;Cut, copy, paste, select all - Text Format;Font, Color - Code Library, Contains every single variable etc - Changed the RenderingMode on the Menustrip - Made the TextBox AutoFill - Added Line Count - 100% Credits to Lin - Added more icons - Added a bigger and more stable code library.
Current bug count: 0!
Current Code Library: command.e.normal command.e.moderator command.e.admin command.e.owner command.s.normal command.s.moderator command.s.admin command.s.owner comand.s command.e bw.new bw.write bw.new.line add add.item add.xp del.item get.item.slot message.to.all save save.char save.moreinfo save.stats message set.anim set.teleblock.true set.teleblock.false tox toy
Pictures: [URL=http://img229.imageshack.us/img229/3905/teleblock.jpg/][IMG]http://img229.imageshack.us/img229/3905/teleblock.jpg[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://img406.imageshack.us/img406/1559/skillxp.jpg][IMG]http://img406.imageshack.us/img406/1559/skillxp.jpg[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://img365.imageshack.us/img365/4694/additem.jpg][IMG]http://img365.imageshack.us/img365/4694/additem.jpg[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://img148.imageshack.us/i/messagetoall.jpg/][IMG]http://img148.imageshack.us/img148/7189/messagetoall.th.jpg[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://img406.imageshack.us/img406/3807/save.jpg][IMG]http://img406.imageshack.us/img406/3807/save.jpg[/img][/URL]
Download Links: Uppit: http://uppit.com/v/F7HRI827
Next Update: BETA 4: Will be possibly Documented.
People who have helped: Icons were from iconspedia Deathchaos9 Mitko Lin
To get your name on list post examples of code for me to add, such as a command that deletes items from invo, opening quest interfaces etc. please give me suggestions, ideas and let me know what you think, Thank-You.
I would like to say Thanks again to Lin, Who has been helping me for quite awhile with this now.
To get started with a teleport command:
Engine Code: command.e.admin("cmd name")){ tox = 1234; toy = 1234; } }
Result: if(playerRights >= 2){ if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("cmd name")){ teleportToX = 1234; teleportToY = 1234; } }
Engine Code: command.e("cmd name")) { add.item(995, 10000); message("write a message here"); add.xp(xp, lvl); }
Result: if command.equalsIgnoreCase("cmd name")) { addItem(995, 10000); sendMessage("write a message here"); addSkillXP(xp, lvl); }

item.title: RSPS Script Engine - MUST READ - Last Updated: July 03 - BETA 3
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Skill09 Mod Skill09
item.description:
@Mod_Skill09 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:74, topic:286193”]Why don’t you just make a list of what people use, so like (C#)…

[code]string[] things = new string[100];

void setThings()
{
things[0] = command;
things[1] = e;
things[2] = admin;
//Etc, or you can simply do string[] things = {“command”, “e”, “admin”, };[/code]

That way people can customize it, and you’ll just have to load the things from an array. Oh and one more thing: Always when checking your code, lower everything that’s not a string to lower case and then check it, unless you want it to be case sensitive.
}[/quote]
Thanks, I am working on C# version, there will be a VB Version, C# Version and a case sensitive version. I’ll also m,ake it so people can either do command.e.admin or command.e etc so you don’t HAVE to have playerRights iuf you don’t want to. [br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 02, 2009, 07:32:08 pm[/size][hr]bump I updated it : )

Read full topic
item.source: RSPS Script Engine - MUST READ - Last Updated: July 03 - BETA 3

item.title: RSPS Script Engine - MUST READ - Last Updated: July 03 - BETA 3
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Why don’t you just make a list of what people use, so like (C#)…

[code]string[] things = new string[100];

void setThings()
{
things[0] = command;
things[1] = e;
things[2] = admin;
//Etc, or you can simply do string[] things = {“command”, “e”, “admin”, };[/code]

That way people can customize it, and you’ll just have to load the things from an array. Oh and one more thing: Always when checking your code, lower everything that’s not a string to lower case and then check it, unless you want it to be case sensitive.
}

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Script Engine - MUST READ - Last Updated: July 03 - BETA 3
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:71, topic:286193”][quote author=Mod Skill09 link=topic=378526.msg2849573#msg2849573 date=1246466697]

why capital free…

He probably uses caps lock instead of shift.

YEH SAME HERE. its like day and night. jk, seriously though this seems a little to much to release for the average mscper to use.

I made it capital free so it was easier to use, I have seen ALOT of people complain about java being case-sensitive, and what do you mean this is too much for the average moparscaper? is it too hard to use? I did put alot of effort into this.
[/quote]

I agree, you have put a lot of effort into this. That being said, it is convieniant for you to use, but unless properly documented (and even if it is documented well), a normal moparscape simply won’t understand it.[/quote]
No… it just looks neater when there are capitals.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Mod Skill09, post:61, topic:286193”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=378526.msg2849458#msg2849458 date=1246461841]

Yeah, I do like C#. I just cannot decide on my fav. tho. Btw I have news Bout to upload BETA 2. This includes new features:

  • RendingMode on menustrip was changed
  • AutoFill was set on textbox
  • Added icons to menus
  • Added Line Count (100% creds to Lin!)
  • Delect all my variables, and started again.

instead of c, i now use command.e.normal, command.e.admin etc

EX of command: Script:
command.e.admin(“cmd name”)){
tox = 1234;
toy = 1234;
}
}

Result:
if(playerRights >= 2){
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“cmd name”)){
teleportToX = 1234;
teleportToY = 1234;
}
}

Nice idea, but toX and toY still looks better to me.
[/quote]
I was going to use toX and toY but I wanted an engine that was capitals free. Sorry. If you want me to I can release an engine that has toX and toY just for you? lol Let me know if you want me to.[/quote]
why capital free…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mod_Skill09 Mod Skill09
item.description:
@Mod_Skill09 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:53, topic:286193”]Yea, I love C#.

*variable type* *variable name*Done.

For example,

int tehInteger = 0; int[] tehIntegerArray = new int[32]; public int tehInteger2 = 0; public int[] tehIntegerArray2 = new int[64]; string s = ""; string str = null;Etc…[/quote]
Thanks, But I think I’ll just keep using VB for this project and see how I go. I took your advice and changed the menu’s rendermode to system (i was wondering how to change tht lmfao) and I was going to fix textbox in later verion I just couldn’t be bothered. Thanks. I would Rep++ if i could but I can’t atm lol

item.title: RSPS Script Engine - MUST READ - Last Updated: July 03 - BETA 3
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Skill09 Mod Skill09
item.description:
@Mod_Skill09 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:50, topic:286193”] I detect a VB .NET application.

For looks, set the main textbox/richtextbox’s docking to “Fill” and you won’t have to worry about any manual resizing.

For the menu bar, set the RenderMode to System, or “Professional” while setting the LayoutStyle to “Flow”. Otherwise, the rest of the styles look faggish and ugly.[/quote]
sweet thanks, i do not normally change many of the items properties, and yes VB .Net, i was going to use C# but i do not how to declare variables in C#, what is ‘Dim’ in C#? do you know. [quote=“fellixombc, post:51, topic:286193”]Not to great I must add. If I were to write a new Script Engine, first, I would make it easier to understand.

command(“hello”)
{
talk(“Hi users”);
}

command.Admin(“ban”);
{
ban(); // defined in another void
}

etc, try make it easier on the brain, instead of having short letter/phrases like ‘c’.[/quote]
Thats a good idea, I might use that, if you don’t mind? Thanks.

xxlifeskilxx:

This is a very good idea, this will make coding alot faster, if i find bugs, ill report them to you, and ill give you more ideas for the program

Thanks, glad people are startring to like it

Read full topic
